entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 4:15PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Altimeter Settings Could Exceed 31 Inches... Very strong high pressure building along the ALCAN Border tonight, combined with very cold temperatures, could cause altimeter settings to rise above 31.00 inches tonight and Tuesday over the Yukon Flats, and along the Yukon Valley upstream to Eagle and along the Porcupine River. Altimeter settings above 31.00 inches

entry.summary: ...Icy Patches Likely Overnight Into Tuesday Morning... Falling temperatures and water from melted snow will result in patchy ice on area roads overnight into early Tuesday. This will be especially problematic on untreated roadways. Motorists should exercise extra caution overnight into early Tuesday, and assume that any surfaces which look wet or slushy may in fact be icy.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 9:55PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Black Ice Tonight... Melted snow and slush on untreated roads and sidewalks will freeze tonight as temperatures bottom out in the single digits and teens. Black ice will be difficult to see and may look like water on surfaces. Use caution if traveling tonight and Tuesday morning. Some roads will be slippery.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 8:02PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Icy Patches Likely Overnight Into Tuesday Morning... Falling temperatures and water from melted snow will result in patchy ice on area roads overnight into early Tuesday. This will be especially problematic on untreated roadways. Motorists should exercise extra caution overnight into early Tuesday, and assume that any surfaces which look wet or slushy may in fact be icy.
